title: geth crashed
body:
#### System information
Geth Version: 1.8.10-stable
Git Commit: eae63c511ceafab14b92e274c1b18bf1700e2d3d
OS & Version: Linux Mint 18.3
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.10
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go-1.10

#### Expected behaviour
syncing

#### Actual behaviour
crash

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
```
$ geth --cache 4096 --ethash.cachesinmem 64 --trie-cache-gens 1024  --maxpeers 32


INFO [05-31|07:21:46] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=153  mgas=7.984  elapsed=1.053s    mgasps=7.579  number=5704678 hash=f595e4…e1c10d cache=124.16mB
INFO [05-31|07:21:52] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=202  mgas=7.884  elapsed=930.199ms mgasps=8.476  number=5704678 hash=afb301…40cba2 cache=124.39mB
INFO [05-31|07:22:13] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1  txs=133  mgas=7.989  elapsed=1.099s    mgasps=7.265  number=5704680 hash=31b5d2…7d5cf3 cache=124.36mB
panic: leveldb: internal key "", len=0: invalid length

goroutine 1671817 [running]:
```

Can't say I've ever seen this error message. Seems to originate from leveldb, some internal corruption. Not sure if there's anything we can do about it. Did your instance crash by any chance? Power outage? Bad sectors on disk?

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have or find the answers we need so that we can investigate further.
